meta.title: Accessibility | Dev Showcase
meta.description: Accessibility practices implemented in Dev Showcase — skip links, ARIA, keyboard navigation, contrast and more.

hero.title: Accessible to all
hero.description: Accessibility is not an optional feature — it's foundational. Learn about all practices implemented in Dev Showcase.

features.title: What we already do
features.description: Accessibility features present throughout the project.

skipLink.title: Skip Link
skipLink.description: Invisible link at the top of the page that allows skipping navigation and going directly to main content. Appears when pressing Tab.

semanticHtml.title: Semantic HTML
semanticHtml.description: Correct use of header, main, nav, section, article and footer. Heading hierarchy h1→h2→h3 on all pages.

ariaRoles.title: ARIA Roles & Labels
ariaRoles.description: role='navigation', role='status', aria-label, aria-live='polite' on dynamic elements. Screen readers receive adequate context.

keyboardNav.title: Keyboard Navigation
keyboardNav.description: All interactive elements are accessible via Tab, Enter and Escape. Visible focus with consistent outline.

focusManagement.title: Focus Management
focusManagement.description: Focus traps in modals and mobile menus. Focus returns to the originating element when closing dialogs.

colorContrast.title: Color Contrast
colorContrast.description: Primary and text colors follow WCAG AA guidelines. Dark mode maintains adequate contrast.

responsiveText.title: Responsive Text
responsiveText.description: Scalable fonts with rem/em. Support for zoom up to 200% without layout breakage.

reducedMotion.title: Reduced Motion
reducedMotion.description: Framer Motion animations respect prefers-reduced-motion. Sensitive users see simplified transitions.

checklist.title: Checklist for contributors
checklist.description: Before submitting a PR, verify these accessibility items.

items.semantics: Use semantic HTML elements (button, not div with onClick)
items.headings: Maintain heading hierarchy (h1→h2→h3, no skipping levels)
items.altText: Add descriptive alt text to all images
items.keyboard: Test complete navigation via keyboard (Tab, Enter, Escape)
items.focus: Ensure visible focus on all interactive elements
items.contrast: Verify minimum contrast 4.5:1 for normal text
items.forms: Associate labels with inputs using htmlFor/id
items.errors: Announce form errors to screen readers with aria-live

tools.title: How to test accessibility
tools.description: Recommended tools for validating accessibility in the project.

lighthouse.title: Lighthouse
lighthouse.description: Audit integrated in Chrome DevTools. Run in 'Accessibility' mode for score and suggestions.

axe.title: axe DevTools
axe.description: Browser extension that detects WCAG violations automatically. Identifies contrast, ARIA and semantics.

screenReader.title: Screen Readers
screenReader.description: Test with NVDA (Windows), VoiceOver (Mac) or Orca (Linux). Navigate the page with keyboard and audio only.

tabTest.title: Tab Test
tabTest.description: Navigate the site using only Tab and Shift+Tab. Verify the order is logical and all elements are reachable.

contrastChecker.title: Contrast Checker
contrastChecker.description: Use WebAIM Contrast Checker or DevTools tools to verify contrast ratios.

guidelines.title: Standards we follow
guidelines.description: References and guidelines that guide our accessibility decisions.

wcag.title: WCAG 2.1 AA
wcag.description: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines — international accessibility standard. We follow level AA.

waiAria.title: WAI-ARIA 1.2
waiAria.description: Specification for roles, states and properties to enrich semantics of interactive components.

a11yProject.title: The A11Y Project
a11yProject.description: Community resource with checklists, articles and accessible best practices.
